header.title: Updating bash for Mac OS X

section.title: Introduction
section.p: A new bash is required to get rid of the s√°mi characters problem when working in the Terminal on the Mac.

section.title: Install new readline library (readline-5.0)
section.p: First we need to install new readline library
Move the readline directory to /tmp/ and install it.
section.source: ssh adminis@localhost (asks admin password) mv Desktop/readline-5.0 /tmp/ make install

section.title: Install new bash (bash-3.0)
section.p: Then, download and install new bash.
Move the bash directory to /tmp/ and install it.
section.source: ssh adminis@localhost (asks admin password) mv Desktop/bash-3.0-1-osx3 /tmp/ ./configure make install

section.title: To enable new bash when starting bash in Terminal.
section.source: sudo mv /bin/bash /bin/bash-old sudo ln -s /usr/local/bin/bash /bin/bash sudo mv /usr/share/man/man1/bash.1 /usr/share/man/man1/bash-old.1
section.p: The last command is for having manual pages for the new bash.
